{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3332816,"name":"Tommy","username":"tbeadle","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e495f1/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T12:20:10.092Z","cooked":"

I’m struggling to tune the translation and rotation PIDConstants for our HolonomicPathFollowerConfig and am looking for guidance on how to do that. I got our swerve modules pretty well tuned with a feed forward and P constant so that they spin at the requested velocity by using a command to just drive straight at a couple different velocities and comparing the requested velocity with the velocity recorded for the motors in AdvantageScope. But now when I try to use PathPlanner to follow a path, even just a straight path at 0.5 m/s, it’s a bit erratic. What is a good strategy for tuning those values? Is there anything else that I should be considering? Is there a good way to use Shuffleboard to be able to test different values without having to re-deploy the code?

As far as I know, pathplanner has defaults which should get you most of the way there

We had a similar issue, but this was caused because we aligned the bevel gears on the swerve in the wrong direction. Try adding a Math.Pi to your offsets and see if that helps!

tbeadle:

straight path at 0.5 m/s, it’s a bit erratic

You didn’t define erratic and if you have a long straight path with only the two end points then there is nothing to control to. You’ll see any drift that’s built into the robot. Add a bunch of intermediate points or a slight curve and see if that takes care of your problem.
